objectives: Pupils can identify and distinguish between different sounds in the environment.
activities: Sound Walk: Walking around the school and identifying sounds like birds chirping or cars passing.
Close Your Eyes: Teacher makes a sound (clapping, snapping) and pupils guess the action.
assessment: Observation of pupils' responses to sounds.

standards: 1.1.1 - Listen to and identify common sounds in the environment
objectives: Pupils can name at least 3 common environmental sounds correctly.
activities: Sound Bingo: Marking pictures on a card based on the sounds played.
Mystery Box: Identifying objects inside a box by the sound they make when shaken.
assessment: Correct identification during the mystery box game.

standards: 1.1.2 - Listen to and respond to rhymes and songs
objectives: Pupils can perform actions that correspond to the lyrics of a song.
activities: Action Songs: Singing 'If You're Happy and You Know It' with matching movements.
Freeze Dance: Dancing to rhymes and stopping when the music stops.
assessment: Observation of physical response to lyrics.
Checklist of pupils' engagement in singing.

standards: 1.1.3 - Listen to and identify rimes in nursery rhymes and songs
objectives: Pupils can identify words that rhyme (e.g., cat/hat) in a song.
activities: Rhyme Match: Raising hands when they hear two words that rhyme in a poem.
Odd One Out: Identifying which word does not rhyme in a set of three.

standards: 1.2 - Understand meaning in a variety of familiar contexts
objectives: Pupils can comprehend simple instructions and information given in English.
activities: Total Physical Response (TPR): Pupils follow commands like 'Touch your nose' or 'Sit down'.
Listen and Draw: Pupils draw simple shapes or items based on teacher's instructions.

objectives: Pupils can execute two-step instructions (e.g., 'Pick up the pencil and put it on the desk').
activities: Simon Says: A classic game to practice listening and following specific commands.
Obstacle Course: Following verbal directions to navigate a simple path.
assessment: Observation of pupils' reaction time to commands.

standards: 1.2.2 - Listen to and respond to stories
objectives: Pupils can answer simple 'Who' or 'What' questions about a story they heard.
activities: Story Time: Listening to a short story and pointing to characters in a book.
Puppet Show: Watching a story and predicting what happens next.
assessment: Retelling parts of the story using pictures.

objectives: Pupils can repeat common greetings with correct pronunciation.
activities: Hello Song: Singing a greeting song to peers every morning.
Role-play: Practicing 'Good morning', 'How are you?' with a partner.
assessment: Observation of social interaction using greetings.

objectives: Pupils can express basic needs and information about themselves verbally.
activities: Show and Tell: Bringing an item from home and saying its name in English.
All About Me: Saying their name, age, and favorite color to the class.

objectives: Pupils can state their name and gender correctly in English.
activities: Circle Time: Passing a ball and introducing oneself when the music stops.
Identity Card: Filling a simple card with help and reciting the info.

objectives: Pupils can name at least 10 common classroom objects in English.
activities: Labeling Game: Sticking labels on the correct items (chair, table, fan).
I Spy: Playing 'I Spy with my little eye' using objects in the room.

objectives: Pupils can respond to basic 'Yes/No' and 'What' questions.
activities: Question Ball: Tossing a ball with questions written on each section.
Doctor-Patient Role Play: Asking 'What's wrong?' and answering.

objectives: Pupils can state what they like or dislike (e.g., 'I like apples').
activities: Like/Dislike Chart: Placing pictures of food under a 'Happy' or 'Sad' face.
Interview: Asking a friend 'Do you like cats?'.

standards: 3.1 - Recognize and read letters of the alphabet
objectives: Pupils can name and recognize uppercase and lowercase letters.
activities: Alphabet Fishing: Catching magnetic letters and naming them.
Letter Hunt: Finding specific letters hidden in a picture or the classroom.

objectives: Pupils can identify letters out of sequence.
activities: Alphabet Soup: Picking a letter from a bowl and naming it.
Letter Body Shapes: Using their bodies to form letters like 'C' or 'L'.

kategori: 3.1.2 - Recognize and sound out initial sounds
objectives: Pupils can produce the correct phoneme sound for a given letter.
activities: Phonics Song: Singing an 'A is for /a/ /a/ Apple' type song.
Initial Sound Sorting: Sorting objects into baskets labeled with letters.

objectives: Pupils can blend three sounds (CVC) to read simple words like 'cat'.
activities: Word Building: Sliding letters together to form a word on a board.
Phoneme Jumping: Jumping on floor mats with letters /c/ /a/ /t/ and saying 'CAT'.

objectives: Pupils can read common sight words and simple phrases.
activities: Sight Word Jump: Jumping on sight word cards scattered on the floor.
Match Word to Picture: Connecting a printed word (e.g. dog) to its image.

objectives: Pupils can demonstrate the correct grip and hand movement for writing.
activities: Sand Tracing: Writing letters or patterns in a tray of sand.
Air Writing: Tracing large letter shapes in the air with their fingers.

objectives: Pupils can follow dotted lines to form shapes or letters.
activities: Maze Puzzles: Drawing a line to help an animal reach its food.
Sticker Tracing: Placing small stickers along the outline of a letter.

objectives: Pupils can copy letters and simple words from a model.
activities: Rainbow Writing: Copying a word several times using different colors.
Whiteboard Copy: Copying words written by the teacher onto their own boards.

objectives: Pupils can write simple words or their own name independently.
activities: Name Decorating: Writing their name and decorating it with glitter.
Fill in the Blanks: Writing the missing initial letter for a picture.

objectives: Pupils can write short phrases with teacher's guidance.
activities: Greeting Cards: Writing 'I love Mom' or 'Happy Birthday' on a card.
Labeling My Drawing: Drawing a picture and writing a phrase like 'A big sun'.
